title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are in a better position to acquire key players after a 2025 playoff appearance.
The team faces potential roster gaps as Alex Bregman might opt out, with decisions needed on Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
With a strong farm system and $25 million under the luxury tax, the Red Sox have resources to address roster needs.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel claims Patriots changes aren't about separating from team's past success in his first year as head coach.
Patriots now introduce offensive starters individually, ending 24-year tradition of team introductions before games.
Vrabel's new approaches helped Patriots achieve a 6-2 record, leading the AFC East and likely securing a playoff spot.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Elias Lindholm injured his knee, expected out for weeks after colliding with Sabres' Jordan Greenway.
Coach Marco Sturm promotes Marat Khusnutdinov to first-line center, replacing injured Lindholm for upcoming games.
Lindholm's absence impacts Bruins' power play; he's second in power play goals in the league this season.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in costume flooded Salem on Halloween, bustling through markets and scenic autumn settings.
Highlights included a Joker-costumed visitor and a viral vampire amidst street performances and haunted exhibits.
Salem's packed streets featured chartered cemeteries, memorial dedications, and popular Halloween attractions.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused Donald Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein without providing evidence during a TV interview.
Moulton suggested Trump was represented in Epstein's files, claiming corruption and abuse, sparking a tense exchange with MSNBC's Joe Scarborough.
Scarborough challenged Moulton's unproven claims against Trump, emphasizing the lack of evidence for the serious accusations made.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's trial for the alleged murder of Ana Walshe is set to commence with jury selection on November 18.
A Norfolk judge ordered preservation of key evidence from former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor's cellphone related to the case.
Walshe's lawyer argued that destruction of unrevised documents, possibly containing beneficial information, would prejudice their defense.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market in Newton, Massachusetts, reopened after a three-day closure due to asbestos concerns from demolition work.
Massachusetts DEP confirmed the asbestos was contained in a stockroom, with no detected risk to shoppers.
Asbestos abatement will continue in a sealed area, ensuring no public risk, according to the MassDEP.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace to score 57 goals this NHL season for the Boston Bruins.
Geekie has scored in six consecutive games, with a career-high shot speed of 95.68 mph.
The Bruins' power play benefits from Geekie's increased role, currently ranking 13th in the NHL.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: The Boston Celtics exercised a $2.74 million team option on Baylor Scheierman for the 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman, drafted 30th overall in 2024, played limited minutes, averaging 8.5 per game this season.
Scheierman showcased potential in Summer League with his passing; known for shooting and playmaking skills from Creighton.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots traded defensive end Keion White and a seventh-round pick to the San Francisco 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
White admitted he was not a fit for the Patriots' defensive scheme and struggled to make an impact this season.
The 49ers are optimistic about White's potential, highlighting his versatility and fit in their defensive system.
